title: What are some life lessons you learned in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: 2020. The Year of Covid wrecked us. I watched, as did millions of other people, as this pandemic exploded all over the world. I started social distancing on my own back in January or February, as soon as I heard of covid, due to the fact that so many people were dying, and my parents, being elderly with some health conditions, most likely wouldn’t survive the virus. I am their caregiver. I am now a hermit. This year has taught me a bunch of things. I’m not the most patient person on this earth, and my patience has been tested a number of times. I haven’t been able to conduct normal business, like getting my car inspected and registered, because certain places closed up shop. I haven’t been able to go into a store and just browse, instead I now shop online and do the curbside pickup thing. I haven’t been able to go to a funeral for a family friend. I have missed out on several outdoor gatherings with friends, because I seem to be one of the few people who minds the law, no matter how stupid that law may be. I more than likely won’t be able to attend my first-born granddaughter’s wedding this year. I am sick and tired of coved. Who isn’t? When I let myself go there, I get a feeling of rage in my gut, because of all the lies and misinformation the American people have had thrown at them regarding how to live safely with covid. The fractured economy, the increase in violent crimes, suicide, domestic abuse, and more, the ridiculous notion of wearing masks….all of it just pisses me off. And how do you pick out the truth from the squirming mass of lies that have been told to us all? This year has tested my patience more than any other year, except maybe for 2014, when ISIS was in America, cutting the heads off of innocent Americans right in the damn streets. That was scary for me. Glad the current administration has wiped them out… well, I’m sure they’re not wiped out, just gearing up for more terror somewhere in Bumfukegypt. This year I have become aware of just how far left the democrats have become. This year I am more convinced than ever that we are living in the last days, and that surely Jesus will come again soon. This year has taught me to make sacrifices in the name of love. This year has taught me to not believe everything you read or hear… unless of course it’s on facebook, because everyone knows what you see there is pure 100% truth. NOT. This year has taught me that eating out in a restaurant for a change from cooking every day is a real treat. (I haven’t eaten away from home since February) This year taught me that some people are flakes to the nth degree. 2020 will always be a hell year for me. The year China released a manipulated virus that spread around the world. A virus that opportunists have used to their advantage. The year that saw a crazed rush for a vaccine against covid, one that I will almost certainly refuse, because of the very fact that it hasn’t been tested enough and no one knows what the long term effects of the crap might be. I plan to have a few more good years on earth, and no possible iatrogenic reaction from a rushed vaccine is going to shorten that time I have. I have felt more doubt, fear, and disgust (over all things covid-related) this year than I have ever dealt with in the past. So far, 2020 has pretty much sucked. The only thing that could thrill me this year is if I win a million dollar lotto, or if Donald Trump is reelected. Cynical much? You bet. I no longer trust my government to have my best interest at heart. And besides covid, the political climate in this country is really getting to me also. But I am made from “good hardy German stock” and I shall persevere. As will other Americans struggling this year. Because that’s just what we do. Fall down, get back up. Do the best you can with what you have. Be happy over small pleasures. And always tell your people how much they mean to you. Trust in God and love your country and its flag. Speak up for what you believe to be good and right. And be safe. God Bless America.
